  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon cans of Asphalt sealer (un1294) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 pint of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023120103
item.description:
Report E-2023120103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon poly-drum of corrosive liquid was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and apron underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in using hand tools. All corrosive liquid-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) new 55-gallon drum that was staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was slightly wet when found on the dock. Upon inspection, the metal cans inside were all dented at the bottom and the caps were loose at the top. Caps tightened and PPE was used to clean small spill and placed damage in salvage drum. DescribePack: the metal cans inside were all dented at the bottom and the caps were loose at the top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps tightened and PPE was used to clean small spill and placed damage in salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023120013
item.description:
Report E-2023120013

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 22, 2023, one (1) 250-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide was forked and released approximately seventy (70) gallons of product to the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel transferred the contents of the damaged tote into one (1) new 250-gallon tote. The crew then deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. All sodium hydroxide-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for onsite disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120036
item.description:
Report E-2023120036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Professional Tile and Grout Cleaner (UN1760) were released from a 1-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3153499 and the concrete at dock door 61. The SDS was reviewed by the terminal and it was decided it could be cleaned in house with PPE on site. (1) 30-gallon DF contains one 1-gallon plastic jug of Professional Tile and Grout Cleaner and Oil Dri was created as waste and was left for the terminal to manage.
